channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: The past week should give us hope that by working together Australia will come out the other side stronger.
item.title: It has been tough but the COVID-19 strategy is working

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: National cabinet will meet today to discuss Victoria's aged care crisis and international and interstate travel, after Victoria and NSW recorded their lowest daily case totals in recent weeks.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victoria records 179 new COVID-19 cases as hotel quarantine inquiry continues; border talks intensify between states as Australian death toll jumps to 472

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: ''Freeing the flag'' and the scourge of racism in social media are just two more battles to be fought.
item.title: Dreamtime game comes to NT and Michael Long flies the flag again

item.dc:creator: Anna Prytz
item.description: RMIT University will cut hundreds more jobs as the crisis in the university sector brought on by the coronavirus worsens.
item.title: RMIT University to cut 355 more jobs

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Disgruntled shareholders have commenced legal proceedings in the United States against self-driving car startup Zoox over its $1.3 billion sale to Amazon.
item.title: Mike Cannon-Brookes embroiled in lawsuit over Zoox's $1.8b sale to Amazon

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: Speculation on the venue for the game has been continuous since the coronavirus pandemic spiked in Victoria in recent months.
item.title: 'Heaps better than the Gabba': WA Premier on AFL grand final venue

item.description: No more "Little Rocket Man", exchanging love letters or summit pageantry.
item.title: Biden on North Korea: Fewer summits, tighter sanctions, same stand-off

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: Winx Stakes favourite Master Of Wine has the potential to challenge for the biggest races of the spring according to owner Frank Cook.
item.title: Cooks hope duo for Winx Stakes just the start of big spring

item.dc:creator: Jon Pierik
item.description: Foxtel and Seven have recorded strong ratings for the AFL's compressed rounds 9-12, providing more food for thought for a similar schedule next season.
item.title: Footy frenzy sparks bumper broadcast ratings for Seven, Foxtel

item.description: A special aircraft to take him to Berlin took off from Germany early on Friday morning with a team of doctors on board. The hospital where he is now is refusing to allow him to be moved.
item.title: Navalny's transfer to Germany after suspected tea poisoning in doubt

item.dc:creator: Erin Pearson
item.description: A Rebels bikie enforcer turned commercial drug trafficker filmed test-firing a high-powered assault rifle in a Victorian forest will spend 21 years behind bars.
item.title: Bikie enforcer jailed over guns, drugs and arson as police uncover affair

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: 'He's the one who started it': Premier defends legal stoush with Clive Palmer as the Queensland billionaire reveals new claim for the $30 billion he says the government has admitted it owes him.
item.title: 'He started it': McGowan denies 'poking the bear' as Palmer fires off new $30b claim

item.description: A new exhibition charts the impact of World War II on our architectural landscape.
item.title: Post-war Melbourne needed homes and workers. Snail kits gave us both

item.dc:creator: Karl Quinn
item.description: Catastrophe's Sharon Horgan and her co-creators turn their sharp comic sensibilities on the schoolyard and post-drop-off pecking order.
item.title: Motherland review: hilarious dispatches from the parenting front

item.dc:creator: Jake Wilson
item.description: This week's offerings tackle marriage, religion and war among other challenging topics.
item.title: Top 5 films: the best of what's new in streaming

item.description: There were some surprising benefits for the punters when MWF went online.
item.title: Turning Pages: The joys of a virtual Melbourne Writers Festival

item.description: Pronunciations can rankle, but meander back in time and you can find some succour. But only if you have virtue.
item.title: A pootle through virtual schisms over shedules

item.description: The acclaimed Australian artist's iconic images suddenly make more sense.
item.title: Seeing like Jeffrey Smart: how empty streets gave me a new insight

item.dc:creator: Stephanie Bunbury
item.description: Rather than simply update Victor Hugo's classic novel, director Ladj Ly draws on the violence of everyday life in his own highly policed suburb of Paris.
item.title: Modern-day Les Miserables aimed at Macron

item.description: Two new books on the author of Nineteen Eighty-Four take differing approaches.
item.title: Why George Orwell still has plenty to say

item.dc:creator: Susan Wyndham
item.description: Amanda Lohrey's latest novel is a characteristically warm human story with philosophical foundations
item.title: The tangled life of an artist and a mother

item.dc:creator: Louise Rugendyke
item.description: It was not quite what I expected. I’m sitting in a pub with Bryan Brown and he’s ordering a lemon squash.
item.title: You can’t be a slack arse: Lunch with Bryan Brown

item.description: Barry Dickins meditates on the nature and consequence of acts of violence.
item.title: Non-fiction reviews: One Punch and three other titles

item.description: Souvankham Thammavongsa's short stories are emotional timebombs.
item.title: Fiction reviews: How to Pronounce Knife and three other titles

item.dc:creator: Kylie Northover
item.description: The Melbourne institution taps into youthful optimism with plans for an end-of-year celebration.
item.title: 'We need these young people': St Martins, at 40, looks to the future

item.description: Encountering a plagiarised story raises all sorts of moral issues
item.title: Sickened by the greatest compliment I've ever been paid

item.description: Patrick Mullins looks at the case that ended literary censorship in Australia.
item.title: Portnoy and the complaints of the Australian censors

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: The former vice-president has accepted the Democratic presidential nomination, saying his priority if elected president will be getting the coronavirus pandemic under control, including by introducing a national mask mandate.
item.title: 'The end of this era of American darkness begins tonight': Joe Biden accepts Democratic Party nomination

item.dc:creator: John McDonald
item.description: The Portia Geach Memorial Award – a competition restricted to women artists – has no obvious stand out this year.
item.title: Portia Geach Memorial Award: too much style over substance

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: Knowing I was wanted as a tourist in a country was a big factor in choosing Italy for my first holiday since the pandemic.
item.title: Plucky Puglia shows what travel in COVID era looks like

item.dc:creator: Andrew Webster
item.description: Both father and son are adamant about Tim forging his own path. But there were some invaluable lessons he will take into the ring against Jeff Horn next week.
item.title: In the name of the father: What Tim Tszyu learnt from dad Kostya

item.dc:creator: Tory Maguire
item.description: For Australians, the 4x100m freestyle victory over the US at the Sydney Olympics was one of the country's greatest sporting achievements. National editor Tory Maguire winds back the clock with senior sports reporter Phil Lutton.
item.title: Please Explain podcast: the race we should never have won

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Brandon Smith will undergo jaw surgery as the Storm rule out sending on-loan Harry Grant a pre-finals SOS.
item.title: Storm lose Brandon Smith to broken jaw but rule out sending Grant SOS

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: Long a financial and on-field struggler, Melbourne say they will be without debt next year and are going "unassisted'' - without AFL life support during COVID-19
item.title: Demons to be free of debt and AFL control

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: The hotel quarantine inquiry will resume today to hear its first evidence from a security guard. Three returned travellers and an authorised officer will also tell of their experiences while in the hotels.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victoria records 179 COVID-19 cases; first security guard gives evidence as hotel quarantine inquiry continues

item.description: A frothy pink dress covered in sparkly strawberries has seized the attention of social media users and celebrities alike. But this should have happened back in January.
item.title: The viral strawberry dress that proves the 'worst dressed' list needs to go

item.description: Rug and textile designer Ruth Lazerson recently began hand making mini heart-shaped artworks in resin and ink as gifts for healthcare workers.
item.title: On my mind: Ruth Lazerson

item.dc:creator: Greg Baum
item.description: Twelve rounds in, it is hard to see where and when Adelaide might win a game, but their rookie coach still has his head up.
item.title: Nought, nothing, Nicks

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: Rather than blowing the whistle on the causes of coronavirus, Pat Cash is in fact an example of what I wrote about a month ago – a super spreader for Moronavirus.
item.title: Cash link to brain-dead conspiracy theories is outrageous

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Shai Bolton has been a revelation in the Tigers' midfield this season but the coaches always knew he had it in him.
item.title: Bolton's simple brilliance shines through for Tigers

item.description: A face mask hanging next to a front door, empty sporting fields and work from home spaces. These are the images that tell the story of COVID-19.
item.title: Mass Isolation project a connection in times of 'COVID norm'

item.dc:creator: Barry Divola
item.description: Mary Chapin Carpenter's The Dirt and the Stars, Jon Hatamiya's More Than Anything, the Lemon Twigs' Songs for the General Public and Cut Copy's Freeze, Melt.
item.title: Music reviews: Mary Chapin Carpenter, Cut Copy and more

item.description: For the first time in its 47-year history, the Sydney Opera House has been closed to visitors due to the pandemic. Photographer Daniel Boud has documented the unprecedented downtime.
item.title: It's all so quiet: the Sydney Opera House right now

item.dc:creator: Farrah Tomazin
item.description: The final day of the historic, virtual 2020 Democratic National Convention, as Joe Biden formally accepts the party's nomination as Democratic candidate for president.
item.title: US election 2020 as it happened: Joe Biden accepts Democratic Party presidential nomination at DNC to take on Trump in November

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: Thanks to Joe Biden's closing address for a four-day virtual convention, the Democrats are not just relieved but delighted. Their man did what he had to do.
item.title: 'Sleepy Joe' roars to life with uplifting, passionate speech

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: Negotiations over the release of the sexual harassment report detailing complaints against top AMP executive Boe Pahari have reached a stalemate.
item.title: AMP's behaviour 'unacceptable' says lawyer for former employee

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Reserve Bank governor Philip Lowe has asked state premiers to commit another $40 billion to major infrastructure projects in a two-year spending surge to boost the economy.
item.title: States urged to spend another $40b in Reserve Bank call on jobs

item.dc:creator: Jenny Noyes
item.description: The disgraced businessman has appealed for leniency for the man convicted of dishonestly obtaining a $25,000 loan from him.
item.title: 'I've been to jail, and I don't wish jail on anyone': Rodney Adler

item.dc:creator: Katina Curtis
item.description: The NT goes to the polls on Saturday and while the pandemic led to a majority of voters casting early ballots, it's also likely to contribute to a record low turnout.
item.title: Nation's first coronavirus election plagued by low turnout

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: It has taken almost seven hours to reopen the tracks near Manly train station.
item.title: Cleveland trains resume after truck crashes down embankment onto tracks
